abstract: Troubled borrowers with mortgages from IndyMac will be able to seek lower-priced, fixed-rate loans under a plan unveiled by the regulatory agency that took over the failed thrift.
snippet: Troubled borrowers with mortgages from IndyMac will be able to seek lower-priced, fixed-rate loans under a plan unveiled by the regulatory agency that took over the failed thrift.
lead_paragraph: The regulator that seized IndyMac last month said Wednesday it would help thousands of the failed thrift institution’s cash-short borrowers repay their mortgages and stay in their homes, a model it hoped other banks and collection companies would adopt to stem a wave of new foreclosures in the nation’s weakened housing market.

headline.main: Regulator Will Help Borrowers at IndyMac
headline.print_headline: Regulator Will Help Borrowers At IndyMac
